item.title: Faith, Spirituality & the Future
item.description:
Faith, Spirituality & the Future

This documentary looks at how spirituality is evolving in our culture and what it means for religious institutions.

item.title: 5 Primary Shifts to Become a Place-Based Church - V3 Church Planting Movement
item.description:
5 Primary Shifts to Become a Place-Based Church - V3 Church Planting Movement

What if God is inviting us to let go of some of our defaults in order to join the Spirit in our neighborhoods?

The Rev. Emily Scott was a high-school student in the mid-1990s when she decided to make her faith her career. A gay couple exchanged vows in her family's Seattle church, even though same-sex unions hadn't yet been officially sanctioned by the Episcopal Church. "That was a key moment for me in understanding what church was about," Ms....

Uploaded by Frontline Church Planting on 2015-08-31.

item.title: How We Gather - A New Report On Non-Religious Community
item.description:
How We Gather - A New Report On Non-Religious Community

My colleague Angie Thurston from the Harvard Divinity School and I published a report this week about the nature of millennial non-religious communities. Have a read! How We Gather

item.title: What a congregation knows: The deep wisdom behind odd practices | The Christian Century
item.description:
What a congregation knows: The deep wisdom behind odd practices | The Christian Century

My second call in pastoral ministry was to an urban church composed almost entirely of Alaskan Natives. Their preferred hymnal consisted of four-part, shape-note gospel harmonies and texts from the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

item.title: The Gospel According To Wendell Berry, On Screen
item.description:
The Gospel According To Wendell Berry, On Screen

When Laura Dunn decided to make a film about America's foremost farmer-philosopher, Wendell Berry, she ran into one significant complication: He was willing to be interviewed, but he didn't want to go on-camera. Berry, an old-fashioned man to his core, believes that experiencing the world through computer or movie screens diminishes literacy and deadens the imagination.

item.title: 7 Ways Missional Spirituality is Different than Christian Spirituality - Missio Alliance
item.description:
7 Ways Missional Spirituality is Different than Christian Spirituality - Missio Alliance

Missional spirituality is something that every Christian needs to know about. We all know that "missional" is not primarily about doing more outreach activities in the church but rather about our identity as Christians. In other words, to be missional is to understand that our deepest identity is that we are children of God sent ...

item.description:

What do you believe the future of the church is if we do not start living like we give a damn? **Live Like You Give a Damn: Join the Changemaking Celebration now available for pre-order here...

item.title: Young Entrepreneurs and the Church: Guest Innovator Post #4
item.description:
Young Entrepreneurs and the Church: Guest Innovator Post #4

Meghan Easley is the Project Coordinator at the Fuller Theological Seminary Youth Ministry Institute. She is also a graduate student at U.S.C working on a Masters Degree in Social Entrepreneurship. She has agreed to offer her perspective on social entrepreneurship/impact investing and the church.
